org.neuroph.contrib.neat.gen.operations
Interface FitnessFunction

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractFitnessFunction, MultiplicationFitnessFunction, XorFitnessFunction
public interface FitnessFunction

A FitnessFunction is used to evaluate how well a NeuralNetwork performs the task we are attempting to evolve a NeuralNetwork for. This is the only interface a developer using NEAT must implement. For a simpler-to use abstract class see: @link AbstractFitnessFunction

Author:
Aidan Morgan

Method Summary
 void evaluate(java.util.List<OrganismFitnessScore> fitnesses)
          Evaluates the provided List of OrganismFitnessScores for how well they perform the task we are attempting to evolve a NeuralNetwork for.
 

Method Detail

evaluate

void evaluate(java.util.List<OrganismFitnessScore> fitnesses)
Evaluates the provided List of OrganismFitnessScores for how well they perform the task we are attempting to evolve a NeuralNetwork for. After this callback has been invoked it is expected that the setFitness() for each of the Organisms is set on it's corresponding OrganismFitnessScore. The NeuralNetwork to be evaluated can also be retrieved from the OrganismFitnessScore by using the getNetwork() method.

Parameters:
fitnesses - the List of OrganismFitnessScores to evaluate.
